column4: but it might not work with his audio hardware, as it does not work for my Line6 UX1
I am very familiar with the state of audio on Linux :)
I did a lot of research before buying my RME9652
I have the Line6, it runs on my Windows and my Mac, but no pinguin
I can try to help.  Keep in mind I have hardware that works, so I may not be all that useful :)
I am guessing that you saw this? http://www.ubuntugeek.com/how-to-install-a-line6-guitarport-or-toneport-ux1-or-gx.html

I could get it to playback (output) but the MIC and GUITAR inputs were at the very least very very bad indeed... there is a open driver for their hardware, but not quite good yet, and they say they have not an ounce of interest in Linux "because it would be dificult to mantain" (read - they don't want to open their code to the kernel)
I also have tried to use a low latency kernel, like the UbuntuStudio one... very creepy...
I think I have to keep my penguins toneless for now
I know the song and dance.  RME has products that rock (like my 9652) under linux and some that don't work at all.  You get very different messages sometimes from the same company
Low latency kernels can cause issues with nvidia and fglrx drivers
I am a fan of the low latency kernels (I usually build my own, no real need to do so anymore, it is more of a lifestyle choice)
I have one of these for my laptop:  http://www.vantecusa.com/en/product/view_detail/439
